Header: Putin, Modi set to sign $5 billion missile deal
Content: Russian President, Vladimir Putin arrived in India for annual summit talks with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The two countries will sign the missile deal, estimated at more than $5 billion, during Putin’s visit beginning a Kremlin aide. The United States has warned India against a planned purchase of S-400 surface-to-air missiles from Russia during Putin’s visit, saying such an acquisition would attract sanctions under U.S. law. India’s military wants the missile batteries, both as a deterrent against China and to gain an edge over traditional rival, Pakistan, as they are able to track and shoot down combat aircraft, even stealth planes, at unprecedented ranges.
